text.sentence: Industrials | U.S. Aerospace and Defense twenty one September two thousand fifteen

A Conservative Outlook to Start the Year: On Friday COL released its initial FYsixteen guidance which, as discussed in our recent note, kicked off the year with what is, in our view, a conservative and beatable outlook.

which was not in our forecast, the company guided to a midpoint of dollar five.forty two, higher than our previous estimate of dollar five.thirty with most of the differential coming from a lower tax rate, partially offset by a slightly lower BRS outlook, and a downward tweaking of our IMS and IFE assumptions .

Details of the Guide Don't Show an Effort to Prop up Numbers in the Face of Nearterm Challenges: Numbers at BRS feel adequately de risked with BRS OEM stated down low DD and AM similar to two thousand fifteen, but notably COL is also allowing for additional rate cuts in midsize and light jets on other platforms, which has a conservative feel to us.
These headwinds offset HSD growth at Air Transport and drive our sub one percent estimate at Commercial Systems .
Defense growth of LSD incorporates US defense ~flat for the year and international sales growth.
Cash flow looks to be lighter than anticipated as preproduction engineering cost growth is planned at dollar one hundredmn .

A lower than expected tax rate of twenty eight percent incorporates benefits from tax planning strategies that will impact Htwo of FYsixteen and does not assume an extension of the Federal R and D tax credit.

Resetting the Bar Is the Right Move in Our View: This guide effectively resets the earnings bar to include real near term headwinds while giving COL the opportunity to beat and raise on incremental positives throughout the year .
We think this is a necessary and prudent action on the behalf of management, and we expect that from this team which has demonstrated a propensity to guide conservatively in recent years .

U.S. Aerospace and Defense Industry View: POSITIVE Stock Rating: OVERWEIGHT two thousand fourteenA four thousand nine hundred seventy nine one thousand one hundred ninety nine one thousand fifty eight nine hundred seventy four eight hundred sixty eight six hundred eighteen four.fifty

two thousand fifteenE five thousand two hundred seventy one thousand two hundred ninety six one thousand one hundred thirty eight one thousand forty four nine hundred fifty two six hundred ninety one five.twenty

nine two thousand seventeenE five thousand seven hundred two one thousand four hundred forty five one thousand two hundred fifty eight one thousand one hundred seventy four one thousand ninety three seven hundred sixty three six.five
We believe Rockwell Collins will continue to benefit from cyclical aerospace growth and content gains over the long term.

We also expect positive changes in business mix to be more fullyrealized by the investment community and recent headwinds from defense and business jets to take a back seat to growing Air Transport and IMS segments.

We can see additional upside in COL shares in the event that investors become more optimistic around inflecting growth in COL's end markets or we see less weakness in business and regional systems than currently anticipated.
Upside case based on ~ seventeenx our CYtwo thousand seventeen EPS estimate.

Slower than expected growth and lower margins, challenges integrating ARINC, or higher thanexpected pressures in BRS would likely limit forecasted EPS growth and put downward pressure on estimates and investor sentiment.

Barclays | Rockwell Collins Resumption of Growth in two thousand seventeen Still on Track: With only four percent EPS growth implied in our FYsixteen estimate, valuation is likely to be a topic of conversation among investors as near term headwinds remain in focus.

We think the recently more subdued consensus viewpoint on COL misses the long term growth profile offered by content wins on ramping platforms at Air Transport as well as secular growth trends at I Miss We think that troubles at Bombardier will eventually subside, and although we don't expect the production outcomes from this customer that were once assumed, we see a healthy resumption of EPS growth for COL in the low to mid teens beginning in two thousand seventeen.

More importantly, the changing mix toward Air Transport and IMS provides underlying top line support with multi year growth and visibility that shouldn't be overlooked, potentially arguing for multiple expansion from this point especially if accompanied by beats and raises which with plans like this one could point toward.
FIGURE one COL's Revenue Mix Continues to Shift Toward Faster Growing IMS and Air Transport
FIGURE two Longer Term Visibility is Supported by the Feathering In of Sizable Content Gains at Air Transport
dollar one thousand four hundred dollar one thousand two hundred dollar one thousand dollar eight hundred dollar six hundred dollar four hundred dollar two hundred dollar two thousand eightA

Barclays | Rockwell Collins Shares Performed Roughly In Line with the S and P on Friday; We'd Be Buyers on Any Incremental Weakness This Week: Barring a deterioration in sentiment for commercial aerospace, we think last Friday's guide reset the bar to an appropriate and beatable level to incorporate near term headwinds.
We think the longer term COL story remains very much intact, and would be buyers of incremental weakness.
On our revised estimates, COL shares are trading at ~fifteenx our CYsixteen EPS of dollar five.sixty, a level that we believe appropriately accounts for the expected pause in growth.

Our dollar one hundred one price target assumes that over the next twelve months, as a reacceleration of growth in FY seventeen comes into focus, COL shares could see a modest multiple expansion, even in latter stages of the cycle, largely owing to the content gains and a repositioning as a quality story in aerospace.

Risk Disclosure Master limited partnerships are pass through entities structured as publicly listed partnerships.
For tax purposes, distributions to MLP unit holders may be treated as a return of principal.
Investors should consult their own tax advisors before investing in MLP units.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Below is the list of companies that constitute the industry coverage universe: U.S. Aerospace and Defense Boeing Co. Harris Corp. Lockheed Martin Precision Castparts Corp. Spirit AeroSystems Holdings United Technologies Distribution of Ratings: Barclays Equity Research has two thousand seven hundred two companies under coverage.

Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.
Top Picks: Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
While analysts may highlight other Overweight rated stocks in their published research in addition to their Top Pick, there can only be one Top Pick for each industry.
To view the current list of Top Picks, go to the Top Picks page on Barclays Live .
To see a list of companies that comprise a particular industry coverage universe, please go to http://publicresearch.barclays

Valuation Methodology: Our dollar one hundred one price target is based on the belief that one year from now, COL shares can trade at a ~sixteenx P/E on our CYtwo thousand seventeen EPS estimate of dollar six.twenty four.

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Price Target: Rockwell Collins' served markets are military and commercial aerospace avionics markets, which are subject to large cyclical movements.
Factors impacting demand for air travel or increases in airline bankruptcies could have major negative implications for the company's businesses.
